Package com.ibm.streams.management.resource

Interface StreamsHostResourceManagerMXBean

public interface StreamsHostResourceManagerMXBean
StreamsHostResourceManagerMXBean provides attributes and operations for managing Streams host resources.

ObjectNameBuilder.resourceManager(String, String) can be used with a managerType of RESOURCE_TYPE_STREAMS to build the ObjectName for a StreamsHostResourceManagerMXBean.

  • Method Details

    • getDomain

      String getDomain()
      Returns the unique identifier for the domain for which host resources are being managed.
      Returns:
      the domain identifier.

    • getDomainHosts

      Set<String> getDomainHosts()
      Returns the set of hosts to be used for processing by the domain.
      Returns:
      the domain hosts.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.

    • getType

      String getType()
      Returns the resource manager type. For the Streams host resource manager the value is ResourceMXBean.RESOURCE_TYPE_STREAMS for this resource manager.
      Returns:
      the resource manager type.

    • addDomainHost

      String addDomainHost(String host, String listenerId)
      Adds a host resource to the domain.
      Parameters:
      host - specifies a host identifier that can be used to resolve the host. This can be the long or short host name or the IP address of the host. This value is used as the display name for the host resource.
      listenerId - identifies an operation listener created using createOperationListener. Status messages relating to the progress of this operation are added to the listener as the operation runs. Any existing messages contained in the listener are cleared before the operation starts. If the value is null, this parameter is ignored.
      Returns:
      the resource identifier of the added host resource.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if an operation listener does not exist for the specified listenerId.
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      NullPointerException - if host is null.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.

    • addInstanceHost

      String addInstanceHost(String host, String instance, String listenerId)
      Adds a host resource to an instance.
      Parameters:
      host - specifies a host identifier that can be used to resolve the host. This can be the long or short host name or the IP address of the host. If the host has not previously been added to the domain, this value is used as the display name for the host resource.
      instance - identifies the instance to which the host resource is added.
      listenerId - identifies an operation listener created using createOperationListener. Status messages relating to the progress of this operation are added to the listener as the operation runs. Any existing messages contained in the listener are cleared before the operation starts. If the value is null, this parameter is ignored.
      Returns:
      the resource identifier of the added host resource.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      NullPointerException - if host or instance is null.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.

    • addTag

      void addTag(String host, String tag)
      Adds a resource tag to a host resource.
      Parameters:
      host - specifies a host identifier that can be used to resolve the host. This can be the long or short host name or the IP address of the host.
      tag - specifies the name of an existing domain resource tag.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      NullPointerException - if host or tag is null.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.
      See Also:
      • DomainMXBean.addResourceTag(String, String)

    • createOperationListener

      ObjectName createOperationListener()
      Creates an OperationListenerMXBean for tracking status messages associated with operations invoked on this bean. Once the operation listener is created, the listener Id can be passed as a parameter on operations which support it. An operation listener can be reused for multiple operation invocations; however, the behavior is undefined if it is used for concurrent operations. All existing messages are cleared at the start of each operation for which the listener is used. The unregister operation should be called on the operation listener after the listener is no longer needed to free the associated memory. All operation listeners are automatically unregistered when the monitored bean is unregistered. An operation listener is also automatically unregistered if it has had no activity for a certain amount of time. The inactivity time is controlled by the JMX_INACTIVITY_TIMEOUT property and is set to 30 minutes by default. If an operation listener bean is needed again, a new one can be created.
      Returns:
      the object name of the created listener bean.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.

    • getInstanceHosts

      Set<String> getInstanceHosts(String instance)
      Returns the set of hosts to be used for processing by a specified instance.
      Parameters:
      instance - identifies the instance for which the hosts are returned.
      Returns:
      the instance hosts.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      NullPointerException - if instance is null.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.

    • getNonExclusiveDomainHosts

      Set<String> getNonExclusiveDomainHosts(Set<String> tags)
      Returns the resource identifiers for all domain hosts which have the specified resource tags and are not exclusively allocated to an instance. If tags is null or an empty set, all domain hosts which are not exclusively allocated to an instance are returned.
      Parameters:
      tags - specifies the resource tags contained by the returned domain hosts.
      Returns:
      resource identifiers for domain hosts that are not exclusively allocated to an instance.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.

    • isRunningAsSystemService

      boolean isRunningAsSystemService(String host)
      Indicates whether Streams is running as a system service on a specified host resource.
      Parameters:
      host - specifies a host identifier that can be used to resolve the host. This can be the long or short host name or the IP address of the host.
      Returns:
      true if Streams is running as a system service on the specified host resource.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      NullPointerException - if host is null.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.

    • isTagInUseByAnyHost

      boolean isTagInUseByAnyHost(String tag)
      Indicates whether a specified resource tag is associated with any host resource in the domain.
      Parameters:
      tag - identifies the resource tag to query.
      Returns:
      true if the resource tag is associated with any host resource.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      NullPointerException - if tag is null.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.

    • removeDomainHost

      void removeDomainHost(String host, String listenerId)
      Removes a host resource from the domain.
      Parameters:
      host - specifies a host identifier that can be used to resolve the host. This can be the long or short host name or the IP address of the host.
      listenerId - identifies an operation listener created using createOperationListener. Status messages relating to the progress of this operation are added to the listener as the operation runs. Any existing messages contained in the listener are cleared before the operation starts. If the value is null, this parameter is ignored.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if an operation listener does not exist for the specified listenerId.
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      NullPointerException - if host is null.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.

    • removeInstanceHost

      void removeInstanceHost(String host, String instance)
      Removes a host resource from an instance.
      Parameters:
      host - specifies a host identifier that can be used to resolve the host. This can be the long or short host name or the IP address of the host.
      instance - specifies the unique identifier for the instance from which the host is removed.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      NullPointerException - if host or instance is null.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.

    • removeTag

      void removeTag(String host, String tag, String listenerId)
      Removes a resource tag from a host resource.
      Parameters:
      host - specifies a host identifier that can be used to resolve the host. This can be the long or short host name or the IP address of the host.
      tag - specifies the name of the resource tag to remove.
      listenerId - identifies an operation listener created using createOperationListener. Status messages relating to the progress of this operation are added to the listener as the operation runs. Any existing messages contained in the listener are cleared before the operation starts. If the value is null, this parameter is ignored.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if an operation listener does not exist for the specified listenerId.
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      NullPointerException - if host or tag is null.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.

    • restrictDomainHost

      void restrictDomainHost(String host, String tag, boolean allowActiveInstances)
      Identifies a resource tag as a restricted resource tag for a host resource. If a host has restricted resource tags, only processing elements (PEs) which require this set of resource tags are allowed to run on the host.

      Notes:

      • The resource tag must first be added to the host.
      • The resource tag cannot be a reserved tag
      Parameters:
      host - specifies a host identifier that can be used to resolve the host. This can be the long or short host name or the IP address of the host.
      tag - specifies the name of the host resource tag to be identified as a restricted resource tag for the host.
      allowActiveInstances - indicates whether the restriction can be applied while the resource is being used to run instance services or jobs. If this value is false and this resource is being used to run any instance services or jobs, the request fails.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      NullPointerException - if host or tag is null.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.
      See Also:
      • ResourceMXBean.getRestrictedTags()
      • unrestrictDomainHost(String, String)

    • unrestrictDomainHost

      void unrestrictDomainHost(String host, String tag)
      Removes a resource tag from the list of restricted host tags for a host. If a host has restricted resource tags, only processing elements (PEs) which require this set of resource tags are allowed to run on the host.
      Parameters:
      host - specifies a host identifier that can be used to resolve the host. This can be the long or short host name or the IP address of the host.
      tag - specifies the name of the host resource tag to be removed from the restricted resource tag list for the host.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if an operation listener does not exist for the specified listenerId.
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      NullPointerException - if host or tag is null.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.
      See Also:
      • restrictDomainHost(String, String, boolean)
